conbody.p: Portuguese plug-in converters support the Portuguese SMS encoding using the National Language Encoding.
This section describes the different Portuguese plug-in converters supported by the Symbian Platform and the alphabets supported by the individual converters.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: The Symbian platform provides three plug-in converters to support Portuguese SMS encoding.

li.p: Default GSM 7bit & Portuguese Single Shift Converter: This converter is identified by KCharacterSetIdentifierPortugueseSingleSms7Bit UID.
Portuguese Locking Shift & GSM 7Bit Extension Converter: This converter is identified by the KCharacterSetIdentifierPortugueseLockingSms7Bit UID.
Portuguese Locking Shift & Single Shift Converter: This converter is identified by the KCharacterSetIdentifierPortugueseLockingAndSingleSms7Bit UID.

section.p: The UID's are defined in the charconv.h file.

Note: For all the converters, any undefined Unicode character is converted to the GSM replacement character (?)0x3F and undefined GSM character is converted to the Unicode replacement character 0xFFFD.

section.title: Alphabet
section.p: The comparison tables listed below are constructed using the Standard SMS Converter as the baseline to provide a better understanding of the character set supported by each converter. The comparison tables help in identifying the character set supported by each converter in comparison with the standard SMS converter.

p.xref: Table 1A Default GSM 7bit & Portuguese Single Shift Converter vs. Standard SMS Converter – Unicode to GSM Code
Table 1B Default GSM 7bit & Portuguese Single Shift Converter vs. Standard SMS Converter – GSM Code to Unicode
Table 2A Portuguese Locking Shift & GSM 7Bit Extension Converter vs. Standard SMS Converter – Unicode to GSM Code
Table 2B Portuguese Locking Shift & GSM 7Bit Extension Converter vs. Standard SMS Converter – GSM Code to Unicode
Table 3A Portuguese Locking Shift & Single Shift Converter vs. Standard SMS Converter – Unicode to GSM Code
Table 3B Portuguese Locking Shift & Single Shift Converter vs. Standard SMS Converter – GSM Code to Unicode
